text: St. Andrew's Church, Lahore St. Andrew's Church in Lahore, Pakistan, was built by the British in 1899, for the Christian employees of the Railways, in the Neo-Gothic style of architecture that was prevalent at the time.St. Andrew's Church ==Location== It was built near the Lahore Railway Station and is also known as the Railway Church.St. Andrew's Church Places of Interest in Lahore, University of Alberta. ==See also== *St. James Church, Lahore, also known as the Pro-Cathedral ==References== Category:Churches completed in 1899 Category:19th-century Roman Catholic church buildings Category:Roman Catholic churches in Lahore
title: St. Andrew's Church, Lahore
